medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute flaccid paralysis of the left leg due to echovirus 19 infection.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed low-grade fever, sore throat, and malaise on 17 June, which was diagnosed as a viral syndrome. On 19 June, she experienced acute flaccid paralysis of the left leg, severe headache with photophobia, fever, and vomiting, prompting hospitalization. Symptoms progressed with diminished strength in the right leg and urinary retention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cystic fibrosis; underwent bilateral lung transplantation in 1991 and 1997; renal transplant in 1999; history of lung transplant rejection and pneumonia.
medical_history.social_history: Traveled to Ukraine to adopt a child shortly before symptom onset, where the child had a 'cold'.
